title: Harry Eden (rugby league)
text:
Harry Lindsay Eden (23 May 1943 – 14 December 2006) was a <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played with three Sydney clubs during his career – <a href="Sydney%20Roosters">Eastern Suburbs</a>, <a href="St%20George%20Dragons">St George</a> and <a href="South%20Sydney%20Rabbitohs">South Sydney Rabbitohs</a>. He was born in Sydney and played junior rugby league for Ramsgate United in the St George Junior league.
Career.
Eden began his career with the Eastern Suburbs club as a in 1969 before moving to the <a href="St.%20George%20Dragons">St. George Dragons</a> where he played in the <a href="Rugby%20league%20positions%23The%20front%20row">front row</a>.
He played three seasons with the Dragons between 1971–1973 and was a member of St George first grade team that was defeated by South Sydney in the <a href="1971%20NSWRFL%20season">1971 Grand Final</a>.
He was a member of the St. George Third Grade side that won the premiership in 1972. Harry Eden played his last two seasons with <a href="South%20Sydney%20Rabbitohs">South Sydney Rabbitohs</a> in 1974 and 1975. He was the uncle of <a href="Rothmans%20Medal">Rothmans Medal</a> winner <a href="Michael%20Eden">Michael Eden</a>.
Harry Eden still holds the record for the most tries in a season by a <a href="Rugby%20league%20positions">prop forward</a>, set while playing for <a href="South%20Sydney%20Rabbitohs">South Sydney Rabbitohs</a> during the 1975 season.
Death.
Harry Eden died of cancer in 2006 aged 63.
